result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tayvior Devron Glover Warfield

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tayvior Devron Glover Warfield not in court, in custody, appearance  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court for Tayvior Devron Glover Warfield.  Attorney Jessica Bellows in court for State of Wisconsin. 
The Dr. report has not been submitted as yet, therefore the defense is requesting an additional date for scheduling.  With no objection from the State, the Court agreed to adjourn case in Br 45.  mn
Scheduling conference scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tayvior Devron Glover Warfield not in court, in custody.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court for Tayvior Devron Glover Warfield.  Attorney Jessica Bellows in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant's appearance waived.  Discovery and offer has been received by defense.  Defense has retained an expert to review the forensic interview, however the expert can't review the interview til October.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court, defendant Tayvior Devron Glover Warfield not in court, in custody.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant's apperance waived.  Discovery has been received by defense.  At the request of counsel this matter is adjourned for scheduling in Br 45.  mn  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Tayvior Devron Glover Warfield in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Defendant Tayvior Devron Glover Warfield in custody.  Kathryn Ginsberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tayvior Devron Glover Warfield appeared by video means.
Case in court for a bail/bond hearing at the request of the defense. State objects to the bail motion. Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Court vacates the scheduled scheduling conference and set the matter over for a status conference. Case remains calendared in Br. 34.   All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Judge Jean Kies, Br 45, room 502 SB  Status conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Tayvior Devron Glover Warfield in court, appear by video with attorney Brett Lee Copeland, appear by video.  Defendant Tayvior Devron Glover Warfield in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Detective Z. Thoms.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 34. Defense wants to be heard on bail.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Motion and Notice of Motion For Bail Reduction from Defendant (Yayvior Warfield - 2022005705 House of Correction 8885 S. 68 th Street. Franklin WI 53132)

Defendant Tayvior Devron Glover Warfield not in court, defendant in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present.  OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. Court adjourns case for an attorney to be appointed. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with ALF; NJF; Glover W.; Nadine W.; Tamika G. W
 No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Tayvior Devron Glover Warfield in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Tayvior Devron Glover Warfield in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tayvior Devron Glover Warfield appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
